page.title: 17HULLS MUSEUMS
page.content: Hull certainly seems to like its Museums. There are 3 Museums in the city centre each dealing with a different aspect of Hulls history. The most popular is also the most central, the Town Docks Museum, housed in the old Dock Offices which were built in 1871. The theme here is a maritime one, with special interest in whaling, 137,000 people visited last year. On the old High Street are 2 museums one based on Wilberforce House containing furniture and things to do with the slave trade which William Wilberforce helped abolish. 54,000 people visited it last year. Finally there is the Transport and Archiology museum housed in the old Corn Exchange. Together with old forms of transport we have some of the best Roman Mosaics in Britain and 54,600 people visited last year.
